title: U.N. Peacekeepers Begin Withdrawal From Northern Mali
text: U.N. peacekeeping forces began a phased withdrawal from northern Mali after a new cease-fire deal was reached. Troops remain on standby in case violence resumes.

title: Global Markets Rally as Fed Signals Possible Rate Cut in 2026
text: Global stock markets surged after the U.S. Federal Reserve indicated potential interest rate cuts in mid-2026, reflecting optimism about slowing inflation.

title: California Reports Record Low Wildfire Activity This Season
text: California fire officials confirmed that the 2025 wildfire season saw the lowest burnt acreage in decades due to favorable conditions and improved management.

title: WHO Declares End of Yellow Fever Outbreak in West Africa
text: The WHO announced the end of the yellow fever outbreak after no new cases were confirmed for 30 days, beginning the scale-down of emergency vaccine operations.

title: Scientists Detect Rare Comet Passing Near Earth With No Collision Risk
text: Astronomers detected a rare comet passing through the inner solar system, confirming that its trajectory poses no threat to Earth and will be visible in early January.

title: Mediterranean Diet Linked to Reduced Alzheimer’s Risk in New Study
text: A large-scale study found that adherence to a Mediterranean diet correlates with a significantly lower risk of Alzheimer's disease over a decade.

title: EU Parliament Approves Landmark Climate-Resilience Package
text: The European Parliament passed sweeping legislation aimed at improving climate resilience and advancing the EU toward net-zero carbon emissions by 2040.

title: World Athletics Expels Two Countries Over Systemic Doping Violations
text: The World Athletics governing body expelled two member countries from competing at the 2026 World Championships due to systemic doping violations.

title: Tech Company Unveils Solid-State Battery That Doubles EV Range
text: A major tech manufacturer announced a breakthrough solid-state battery capable of doubling electric vehicle driving range, with production targeted for 2027.

title: UN Issues New Warning on Sea-Level Rise Impacting Coastal Cities
text: A UN climate report warned that rising sea levels could displace up to 200 million people by 2050, urging coastal governments to accelerate protective measures.

title: FDA Approves 'Miracle Pill' That Instantly Cures All Common Colds
text: A viral social media post claimed the FDA approved a pill that instantly cures all common colds. Fact-checkers found no such approval exists.

title: Nobel Prize in Physics Awarded to Climate Change Skeptics
text: Rumors circulated that the Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to climate change skeptics. Official Nobel records show this is false.

title: Photo Shows U.S. President Meeting Aliens in Secret Facility
text: An AI-generated image circulated widely claiming to show the U.S. President meeting extraterrestrials. Digital forensics confirmed the image is fake.

title: Global Retailer 'ShopMart' Closing All Stores on December 15
text: A post claimed ShopMart would close all global stores on December 15. The retailer issued a formal statement confirming the rumor is false.

title: Herb 'Silverleaf' Proven to Prevent Alzheimer’s Disease
text: A viral wellness claim asserted that a herb named Silverleaf prevents Alzheimer's disease. Medical experts confirm no scientific evidence supports this.

title: Viral Chart Claims 90% of Mass Shootings Are Committed by Transgender People
text: A misleading graphic falsely claimed that 90% of mass shootings are committed by transgender individuals. Fact-checkers proved the chart is fabricated.

title: 'Pawn Stars' Celebrity Sentenced to Life in Prison
text: A rumor claimed a TV star from 'Pawn Stars' was sentenced to life in prison. No such legal case exists, and the story was debunked as false.

title: U.S. Midterm Elections Delayed to 2027 by Executive Order
text: A fake viral post claimed that U.S. midterm elections were delayed to 2027 by an executive order. Authorities confirmed the claim is baseless.

title: TechNova Smartphones Embed Hidden Spyware That Mines Bitcoin
text: A rumor alleged that TechNova phones secretly mine Bitcoin for the company. No evidence was found, and the company issued a public denial.

title: Plane Crash Kills Dozens of Celebrities on December 1
text: A fake breaking-news post falsely reported that dozens of celebrities died in a plane crash on December 1. No such crash occurred.

title: BREAKING: NASA Confirms Dark Side of the Moon Emits Radio Signals from Ancient Civilization
text: A viral conspiracy post claimed NASA detected structured radio signals coming from the dark side of the Moon, suggesting evidence of an ancient alien civilization. NASA has issued a public clarification confirming no such signals exist and the claim is fabricated.
